question: If a player commits a foul within the 5 seconds of allowed advantage play, what does the referee do?

options.text: Stop play, advantage cancelled, and apply the relevant sanction for the infringement
Ignore the foul and allow play to continue
Throw-in between 2 opposing players where the foul occurred.

question: The referee may terminate a game because of outside interference.

options.text: False
True

question: In the scenario where the sliotar is played away from the small parallelogram, and then returned before the player leaves the area without interfering with play, what happens if a score is achieved as a result?

options.text: An indirect free is awarded to the opposing team
The goal is allowed.
The score is disallowed

question: A player, when tackling an opponent who is in possession of the sliotar, makes a shoulder to shoulder tackle on her. The referee shall;

options.text: Award a free to the opposing team and issue a Yellow Card to the offending player.
Allow play to continue.
Award a free to the opposing team.

question: A free puck is awarded on the 20m line to the attacking team for an Aggressive Foul outside the large rectangle, in line with the centre of the goal. How many defending players are permitted on the goal-line?

options.text: Five
One
Three
As many as the defending team wish

question: If a temporary blood sub is sent off with a red card can the injured player having been treated for blood injury return to the field of play?

options.text: Yes by replacing anyone of the 14 players
Yes and increase their team back up to 15
No their team must stay down a player at 14

question: A defending player, inside the large rectangle but outside the small rectangle overcarries the ball. Must the referee award;

options.text: A free puck to the attacking team from the centre of the 20m line
A free puck to the attacking team from the 20m line opposite where the foul occurred
A penalty

question: The sliotar touches a team selector on the field of play. The referee shall

options.text: Allow play to continue
Stop play and award a free to the opposing team
Restart play by throwing in the sliotar at the place concerned or appropriate place

question: Before the referee commences a game, the players must take their respective places. At the start of each half the referee;

options.text: Must count the number of players on the field.
Is not required to count the number of players on the field.
May count the number of players on the field.

question: Is the referee obliged in Rule;

options.text: They don't have to sign the team lists
To sign the team lists in Irish
The option of signing them in Irish or English
To sign the team lists in English

question: An attacking player enters the small square before the sliotar enters it and the referee awards a free out to the opposing team. The goalkeeper may take a quick free from her hand:

options.text: True
False

question: A player takes a side line free and the sliotar goes directly between the opposing team's posts and over the crossbar. The referee shall;

options.text: Award 2 points.
Allow the side line free to be re-taken.
Award a point.

question: A player taking a free fails to strike the sliotar at the first attempt. She then strikes the sliotar on the ground. The referee shall;

options.text: Cancel the free and restart play with a throw-in.
Allow play to continue.
Cancel the free and award a free to the opposing team.

question: If a player challenges the authority of the referee by refusing to comply with equipment rules, what will be the consequence according to Official Playing Rule 10.2(g)?

options.text: Award a free to the opposition
Take the players Name, Jersey number and caution them for challenging the authority of the referee.
Take the players Name, Jersey number and order them off for challenging the authority of the referee.
Allow the play to continue

question: The attacking team is in possession inside the 13m line when the referee stops play to enable a seriously injured player to be treated on the field of play. How is play restarted?

options.text: A free puck on the 20m line to the attacking team opposite the point where the play was stopped
A throw-in at the position where the play was when stopped
A throw-in on the 20m line opposite the point where the play was stopped

question: Camogie players are permitted to wear base layers (skins) during games

options.text: False
True

question: When can a player who was bleeding return to the field of play?

options.text: After receiving medical treatment on the field
After changing their playing attire
After cleaning off the blood and covering the injured area

question: A player is awarded a free puck inside the 20m line and retaliates before it is taken. What is the correct award?

options.text: A throw in where the foul occurs
A throw in on the 20m line opposite where the foul occurs
A throw in on the 13m line opposite where the foul occurs

question: A player who is in possession of the sliotar deliberately makes a frontal charge on an opponent who is attempting to tackle them. The referee shall

options.text: award a free to the opposing team and issue a red card
award a free to the opposing team where the foul occurred
award a free to the opposing team and issue a yellow card

question: A player deliberately drops their hurley and hand passes the sliotar the referee shall

options.text: award a free to the opposing team
allow play to continue
throw in the sliotar

question: What is the penalty for spitting at an opponent or official?

options.text: A yellow card
A red card
A free to the opponent's team
Verbal warning to the player

question: Actual playing time in Championship games is how many minutes per half?

options.text: 35 minutes
30 minutes
25 minutes

question: A player uses abusive or threatening language or gestures to a spectator. Must the referee;

options.text: Award a free to the opposing team
Caution (Yellow Card) the player and award a throw-in
Order Off (Red Card) the offender and award a free
Order Off (Red Card) the offender and award a throw-in

question: At the start of each half the referee must count the number of players on the field

options.text: False
True

question: A player receives a caution (yellow card) during "normal time" and is again cautioned during the playing of extra time. Must the player then be sent off (red card)?

options.text: No
Yes

question: When taking a free puck a free taker lifts the sliotar but fails to strike the ball at their first attempt. They proceed to lift the sliotar a second time and strikes the sliotar. The Referee shall:

options.text: Allow play to continue
Award a free to the opposing team
Throw the ball in

question: The referee realises during the half-time interval that they failed to play sufficient additional time at the end of the first half. They may add this extra time on at the end of the second half?

options.text: Yes
No

question: At the start of the game all players with the exception of the 4 players (2 from each side) at the throw in must be;

options.text: Be in their respective positions
Behind the 45 metre line and in their respective positions
Behind the 65 metre line and in their respective positions

question: A free taker deliberately delays the taking of a free. The referee speaks to her about this. She persists in delaying the taking of the free. The referee shall;

options.text: Cancel the free and restart play with a throw-in.
Cancel the free and award a free to the opposing team.
Take the players name and jersey number and issue a Yellow Card, Cancel the free and restart play with a throw-in.

question: If a ball accidentally strikes the referee during play must they;

options.text: Stop the game and award a throw-in at the point where the ball struck them
Allow play to continue
Award a free to the team which had possession

question: How long may a player hold the ball in their hands?

options.text: 4 steps or no longer than the time needed to take 4 steps
10 secs
4 secs

question: After a wide ball the player taking the puck out takes it from outside the small parallelogram. The referee shall

options.text: insist the puck out is retaken
allow play to continue
award a 45m free to the opposing team

question: Can a point be scored by a hand pass?

options.text: No
Yes

question: If play is stopped for an injured player and neither team is in possession, what should happen?

options.text: Indirect Free puck to the team in possession from where the player in possesion was when play was stopped
Indirect Free puck to the opposing team from where the player in possesion was when play was stopped
Throw-in between 2 opposing players where the player in possesion was when play was stopped.

question: After a score, the player taking the puck out must take it;

options.text: From inside the 13m line.
From inside the small parallelogram.
From inside the 13m line and inside the large parallelogram.

question: A player chops down on an opponent's hurley. Does the referee

options.text: Let play continue
Issue the player a yellow card and give a free where the foul occurred
Give a free where the foul occurred

question: If an attacking player enters the small parallelogram before the ball enters the small parallelogram and a point has been scored sufficiently high out of reach of any defender or attacker the referee shall

options.text: award a square ball
award the point
throw in on the 20m line

question: Which of the following is not a Cautionable (Yellow Card) Infraction?

options.text: To behave in any way which is dangerous to an opponent
To challenge the authority of the referee/ match official
To attempt to strike an opponent with or without hurley
To use the hurley of the incorrect size

question: A defending player plays the sliotar towards her own end line but the sliotar is prevented from crossing the end line by a team mentor who is standing on the end line. The referee shall restart play

options.text: With a 45m free to the opposing team.
With a throw-in on the end line.
With a throw-in on the 20m line.

question: A player deliberately advances the ball from the place at which a sideline puck is awarded. Must the referee;

options.text: Cancel the sideline puck and throw in the ball where the foul occurred
Order the sideline puck to be retaken from the correct position
Allow the sideline puck to be taken

question: If a player deliberately drops their hurley the referee shall

options.text: issue a yellow card
allow play to continue
award a free to the opposing team

question: When a clashed ball goes over the end line the referee shall

options.text: award a 65m free.
award a 45m free.
award a puck out.

question: If a foul is committed on a player after they has played the ball and they has scored the referee shall

options.text: Award the score
Award a free from where the foul occurred
Award a free from 20m line

question: A free taker lifts and strikes the sliotar but the ball is mishit. They immediately lift and strike the sliotar a second time. The Referee shall:

options.text: Award a free to the opposing team
Throw the ball in
Allow play to continue

question: What is the penalty for an opposing player being nearer than 10m to the sliotar before the sideline puck is struck?

options.text: Cancel the sideline puck and throw the sliotar in betweeen 2 opposing players
A free puck is awarded from where the foul occurred
Allow the sideline puck to be retaken

question: The Referee's Report should contain the names of the umpires and linesmen.

options.text: No
Yes

question: Camogie players are permitted to wear shorts during games

options.text: True
False

question: The Referee should include the names of temporary (Blood Subs) in his Match Report.

options.text: No
Yes

question: If any player used abusive or threatening language or gestures to a referee match official player or mentor the referee shall

options.text: issue the player with a yellow card
issue the player with a red card
give a verbal warning to the player

question: When two players foul simultaneously in the large parallelogram the referee shall

options.text: throw the ball in where the foul occurred
throw the ball in on the 20m line opposite to where the foul occurred
allow the play to continue
